definition: to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
variant of 匹[pi3]/classifier for cloth: bolt
mate/one of a pair
classifier for horses, mules etc/Taiwan pr. [pi1]/ordinary person/classifier for cloth: bolt/horsepower
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
unsurpassed/unparalleled

sentences.english: SO it is caalled"PRECIOUS SHIP ". this majestic ship was the biggest seagoing vessel in the world at that time .
sentences.chinese: 它体势庞大，巨无匹敌，是当时世界上最大的海船。

sentences.english: Later, in Walpole he was a peerless handball player.
sentences.chinese: 后来在沃波尔，他成了无人可与之匹敌的手球运动员。

sentences.english: Unequaled selection of both new and used equipment.
sentences.chinese: 无可匹敌的选择新的和二手设备。

sentences.english: He soon rivaled the others in skill.
sentences.chinese: 他在技术上不久便与其它人匹敌。

sentences.english: No matter what from clairvoyance and character feel aspect say is incomparable and its simple alive.
sentences.chinese: 无论从透视学或质感来说是无与匹敌的简直是活了。

sentences.english: Jabba's enforcers were no match for a group of determined Rebels led by a Jedi Knight.
sentences.chinese: 贾巴的打手无法与绝地武士领导的顽强义军相匹敌。

sentences.english: No one could rival him in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 这方面无人能与他匹敌。

sentences.english: In the hands of a Jedi, a lightsaber is almost unstoppable.
sentences.chinese: 在一个绝地的手中，一柄光剑几乎是无以匹敌的。

sentences.english: But they cannot generate competing policy.
sentences.chinese: 但他们不能产生匹敌的政策。

sentences.english: Can Carmenere from Chile compete with The Best Red Wines of the World?
sentences.chinese: 智利佳美娜能否匹敌世界最佳红葡萄酒？

sentences.english: Donne cannot rival Milton in grandeur and beauty.
sentences.chinese: 论雄伟优美，多恩无法与弥尔顿匹敌。

sentences.english: Currently, Shanghai is rivaling every great city of the world.
sentences.chinese: 今天，上海的魅力可与每一个伟大的世界城市匹敌。

sentences.english: In the hands of a Jedi, a lightsaber is almost unstoppable .
sentences.chinese: 在一个绝地的手中，一柄光剑几乎是无以匹敌的。

sentences.english: Light finds her treasure of colours through the ishagonism of clouds.
sentences.chinese: 光线在与云霓的匹敌中觅到了她五颜六色的宝贝。

sentences.english: Apparently, it is only rival in terms of quality is the Dragon Seal.
sentences.chinese: 显然，从质量上来说，唯一能与其匹敌的是“龙徽”。

definition: contend against
to match/is comparable with
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
unsurpassed/unparalleled
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
to hope to reach/to strive for
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to be on an equal footing
equally matched/about the same
to strive
to be better than
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
